H4853.def: literally: lifting up (one's) self; hence: = action by which humans turn to (other) humans with the confidence that they will find joy and comfort there

H1516.def: = a land depression sided or encircled by mountains or elevations

H2384.def: = process by which humans see something in a dream or trance, or as a supernatural apparition

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H645.def: = particle linking two propositions, by which Y represents the purpose or result  of X

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H1406.def: = the structure forming the upper covering of a building, usually built as a terrace, to which one goes up by stairs

H5892.def: = relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent {L:villages<SDBH:חָצֵר>}, {L:settlements<SDBH:בַּת>}, and {L:pasturelands<SDBH:מִגְרָשׁ>}; ≈ associated with strength and security

H8663.def: = action by which humans speak loudly

H4392.def: = state in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

H7151.def: = relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent {L:villages<SDBH:חָצֵר>}, {L:settlements<SDBH:בַּת>}, and {L:pasturelands<SDBH:מִגְרָשׁ>}; ≈ associated with strength and security

H1993.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects produce a variety of sounds, often associated with animals, but also with natural phenomena like the waves of a stormy sea

H2491.def: = state in which humans or animal are fatally wounded with a sharp object

H2719.def: = sharp object; ◄ made out of iron or flint; ► used as tool for various purposes

H4191.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression

H4421.def: = armed conflict between different countries or different groups within a country

H7101.def: = a person who is acknowledged by a group as having authority over them ► to provide leadership, often in battle, and justice

H5074.def: = action by which humans or animals move away in haste from a certain place ► in order to escape from a situation that is considered dangerous

H631.def: = causative action by which humans tie (part of) the body of (other) humans or animals with a rope, cord, or chain ► in order to keep them under control

H7198.def: = a strong but flexible piece of wood to which a string is attached for the firing of arrows, ► used for hunting or as weapon of war

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H1272.def: = action by which humans move to another place in haste, ► in order to escape from a dangerous situation

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H4843.def: = state in which a liquid has a sharp, pungent taste; ≈ regarded as unpleasant and unsuitable for consumption; associated with anger and grief

H213.def: = state in which humans feel pressed to act quickly; ≈ often associated with a lack of wisdom

H5162.def: = causative action by which humans or deities seek to make (other) humans feel relief after a time of grief, anxiety, or fear

H7701.def: = action by which humans or wild animals attack other humans and kill, destroy and steal in the process

H1323.def: = direct or indirect female offspring of humans or animals, either biologically or through adoption

H136.def: originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of {L:אָדֹון<SDBH:אָדֹון>}: = way of addressing God as master and lord

H3069.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6635.def: = state of being in the service of the community; ≈ sometimes associated with suffering and heavy labor

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H4103.def: = process by which humans are shaken out of a state of complacency and routine, ◄ as a result of a certain event

H4001.def: = act of treading heavily and noisily on somebody or something; ► usually with the purpose of killing, destroying, desecrating, and/or humiliating

H3998.def: = state in which humans are so much affected by certain circumstances that they do not know what to do

H1516.def: = a land depression sided or encircled by mountains or elevations

H2384.def: = process by which humans see something in a dream or trance, or as a supernatural apparition

H7023.def: = flat construction, ◄ normally made of stone, ► used as a divider of spaces, or to enclose a space

H7771.def: = action by which humans raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else

H2022.def: = a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a {L:hill<SDBH:גִּבְעָה>}

H5867.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Shem<SDBH:שֵׁם>}; ► regarded as founder of a nation with the same name

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H827.def: = long, narrow container ► for storing one's arrows

H7393.def: = upper stone of two stones ► that are used to grind grain into flour; the grain was placed on the stationary bottom stone, and the top stone was pressed down on top of the grain and scraped back and forth

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H6168.def: = causative action by which humans or deities cause the outer layer covering an object to be removed

H4043.def: = a flat, usually round, object; made of wood or metal; ► used in battle; held by a warrior in front of him as protection from the weapons of his opponent; relatively small and easy to maneuver; ≈ associated with protection and therefore often used as an epithet for God

H4005.def: = state in which persons or objects have been selected for their superior competencies or quality

H4390.def: = state or process in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

H7393.def: = upper stone of two stones ► that are used to grind grain into flour; the grain was placed on the stationary bottom stone, and the top stone was pressed down on top of the grain and scraped back and forth

H7896.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H1540.def: = action by which someone takes off his/her clothes, either entirely or in part, ► as a result of which that person becomes naked or improperly dressed, ≈ which is considered a shameful thing to do

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H4539.def: = a relatively large piece of cloth, ► used to close off the entrance to (part of) a tent, or, more generally, as a covering

H3063.def: = man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Leah<SDBH:לֵאָה>}; ► founder of one of the tribes of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}, which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of {L:Solomon<SDBH:שְׁלֹמֹה>}, and, after the exile, a separate administrative district

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H5027.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H5402.def: = class of tools designed to attack and inflict bodily harm on someone else or to defend oneself against similar attacks from other people

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H3293.def: = a large group of trees or shrubs which grow close together and where several wild animals are known to live; ≈ considered to be a dangerous place for humans and domestic animals

H4553.def: = mourning ritual for someone who has died, or for another tragic event; this may include {L:wailing<SDBH:ילל>}, tearing one's clothes, putting on {L:sackcloth<SDBH:שַׂק>}, covering oneself with dust or ashes, {L:fasting<SDBH:צום>} or eating specific food, {L:cutting oneself<SDBH:גדד>}, {L:shaving one's head<SDBH:קרח>}, covering part of one's face, etc.; this usually takes place during a specific period of time and ends after the burial has taken place, but it may also be repeated in later days to commemorate a tragic event

H6629.def: = group of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd

H73.def: = strip ◄ of cloth ► worn around the waist as part of one's uniform

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H3772.def: = causative action by which humans use a knife or another sharp implement to remove something from a larger object

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else
